Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • server.Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.Observer, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Board
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.util.Observer
    Version:
    1.0 date 2020-10-09 This class is managing all the squares that can be colored on the board.
    Author:
    Christoffer Rova
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Board

        public Board(Server server,
             int xSize,
             int ySize,
             int squareSize)
        The constructor for this class that creates a two-dimensional array that is storing Square objects.
        Parameters:
        server - The reference to the server object.
        xSize - The number of squares in width.
        ySize - The number of squares in height.
        squareSize - The size of squares in pixels.

    • Method Detail

      • getSquareColor

        public int getSquareColor(int x,
                          int y)
        This method take x and y coordinates and calls getColor() method in the Square object and returns the color which is stored as a integer.
        Parameters:
        x - X integer coordinate.
        y - Y integer coordinate.
        Returns:
        Integer representing the color.

      • setSquareColor

        public void setSquareColor(int x,
                           int y,
                           int color)
        setSquareColor takes x and y coordinate and a integer representing a color and stores is in the Square object by using the objects own setColor method.
        Parameters:
        x - X integer coordinate.
        y - Y integer coordinate.
        color - Integer representing the color.

      • resetSquares

        public void resetSquares()
        resetSquares loop through all the objects stored in the array "map" and calls the method setSquareColor that will use the Square objects own method setColor() with the integer value 0 which represents white/no color.

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable arg0,
                   java.lang.Object arg1)
        Specified by:

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent

      • paintSquares

        public void paintSquares(java.awt.Graphics g)
        The method that is responsible for painting the squares on the board. It loops through the array and calling the method getSquareColor() with the coordinates as parameters which in turn calls the method getColor() in the Square object. The integer returned is then passed as a parameter to determineColor() which in turn returns a valid Color.color which is used to set the color of the square. "fillRect" then paints the square at the correct coordinate on the board with the correct size as given by the variable squareSize.
        Parameters:
        g - Reference to the Graphic2d object.
